private_information: I am one of two manipulators in the Blocks World instance.
I executed actions 1 through 10 in the given sequence:
agent1.goal: Report the state changes resulting from the actions I executed relative to the provided initial arrangement. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: I am the other manipulator in the Blocks World instance.
I executed actions 11 through 20 in the given sequence:
agent2.goal: Report the state changes resulting from the actions I executed relative to the provided initial arrangement. Do not emit PDDL.

private_information: I coordinate the reports from agent1 and agent2 and must produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' reports and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that encodes the Blocks World domain and the final arrangement of the blocks as the planning goal, targeting the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: This is a standard Blocks World domain where only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Blocks are labeled A B C D E F G H I J.
A is on top of J.
B is on top of E.
D is on top of A.
E is on top of C.
F is on top of H.
H is on top of B.
I is on top of F.
J is on top of G.
The two agents then executed, in order, the 20 actions listed in the agents' private information entries.

report.system_prompt: You are agent1. Using the public information about the initial arrangement and your private list of executed actions, produce a concise description of the state changes you caused and the resulting local configuration after your actions. Do not produce PDDL. Focus only on block relationships and any blocks you moved.
report.prompt: Your name is agent1. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent1->private_information}. Provide a concise description of how the blocks' relationships changed because of your actions and the resulting local configuration. Do not output PDDL.

report.system_prompt: You are agent2. Using the public information about the initial arrangement and your private list of executed actions, produce a concise description of the state changes you caused and the resulting local configuration after your actions. Do not produce PDDL. Focus only on block relationships and any blocks you moved.
report.prompt: Your name is agent2. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following private information: {agents->agent2->private_information}. Provide a concise description of how the blocks' relationships changed because of your actions and the resulting local configuration. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You must integrate the agents' narrative reports and the public initial arrangement to compute the final arrangement of the blocks and produce two files: a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes the Blocks World domain and has as its goal the derived final arrangement. The produced PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions and contributions distinct in your reasoning but the final PDDL domain should contain the standard single-agent Blocks World actions and predicates suitable for FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the initial public information: {environment->public_information} and the agents' reports: {agent1_report} and {agent2_report}. Derive the final arrangement of each block and then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for FastDownwards that represents the Blocks World domain and uses the final arrangement as the planning goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
